 Go find someone else to entertain your antibiblical swill.

 
 I wouldn't go as far as clueless and the evidence that I disregard isn't for lack of reason. I can either show it to be incorrect, partially or in it's entirety through fact and/or the application of common rational sense. 
 
 If you start with the supposition that God is Omnipotent, Omniscient, and benevolent and apply that to the Bible then whatever doesn't conform is not from God. 
 
 It makes no sense for one of the 10 commandments to be Thou shalt not kill( actually should be murder) after commanding the Jews to commit Genocide. More than once, completely erase their existence from the world, every man, woman and child, cut down their groves, throw away gold and silver from their holy places. No talking to, no agreements with and no mercy towards.
 
 Christianity repeats certain themes often. One of the most stated is of glorifying God. God needs no validation from mankind, nor anything else man thinks is important. How arrogant to think that God requires your acknowledgement in order to feel happy or complete or secure or whatever is accomplished by repitiously praising him. 
 
 With that in mind another frequent theme is 
 
 Leviticus 19:18 'You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the sons of your people, but you shall love your neighbor as yourself; I am the LORD.
 
 Matthew 7:12 "In everything, therefore, treat people the same way you want them to treat you, for this is the Law and the Prophets.
 
 Matthew 19:19 HONOR YOUR FATHER AND MOTHER; and YOU SHALL LOVE YOUR NEIGHBOR AS YOURSELF."
 
 Matthew 22:39-40 And the second is like unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself "On these two commandments depend the whole Law and the Prophets."
 
 John 13:34 "A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another, even as I have loved you, that you also love one another.
 
 Romans 13:8 Owe nothing to anyone except to love one another; for he who loves his neighbor has fulfilled the law.
 
 Romans 13:10 Love does no wrong to a neighbor; therefore love is the fulfillment of the law.
 
 
 What would a God of the first statement get from sacrifice or suffering or denial of being or meaningless ceremony or buildings or anything else that Christians say are necessary. We can however co-exist with the whole of God's creation in a manner that would show that we are made in the image of God. 
 
 God is portrayed as a parent and most parents primary goal is to raise kids who are successful. Not necessarily financially, but socially, intellectually and are responsible and self sufficient. Those are things that reflect good parenting and therefore glorify God.
 
 So I may indeed be clueless or this is all just meaningless drivel, but it makes sense to me and until you can come up with something worthwhile that is contrary, I am going to stick to it.
